description:
Best place for Thai food in the area - Small family run place which is authentic in taste. we were a group of 14 who went for lunch, the food taste and portions were great, both veggie and meat based options.

Thai Ice Tea is a must-try and so are the red/green/yellow curries they serve. The downside here is that they have minimal serving/kitchen staff, which increases the time for delivery but definitely worth the wait.
author: Bala S.

description:
Customer service matters.
Refusing to disclose lunch menu online and on the phone then charging a la carte prices meanwhile yelling at your customer will not bring repeated business.  Enjoy the extra $10 you charged today.
BTW, hairnets also matter.
author: D. S.

description:
The Yellow Curry Sauce Saved The Meal

Feeling a little warnout from the weekend but wanting to eat something healthy yet flavorful, Khao Mun Gai, which is tender poached chicken over stemmmed rice accompanied by a garlic/ginger sauce, sings sweet tunes to my belly.  I was equally excited to see rotti, flaky buttery burmise flat bread, on the menu.  One of each yes please!

Khai Mun Gai
If I'm rating this against basic poached chicken, I guess it passes.  I did not care for the bone bits or the moist cabbage it sat on...my use of "moist" was as necessary as that cabbage.  To make matters worse, the garnishing cucumbers were not fresh.

Garlic/Ginger Rice
Did I order rice or porridge???  This lukewarm mush showed evidence that the chef knew what he was serving but does not care if quality is inconsistent.

Rotti w/ Yellow Curry Sauce
For an appetizer that cost 70% of my main, the execution fell flat.  The infant size rotti was moist over it's preferred flaky presentation, cut into small triangles, and accompanied by a choice of three Curries.  The yellow curry is the only reason why this restaurant received two stars.  It was everything you would expect in a curry.

Disclaimer
I ordered my food for delivery via Grubhub.  For some of you, this may change the way you view my review, and that's okay.  I actually hope the food is  better onsite. However, there's a difference between delivery related issues and poor hospitality management.  If restaurant's are willing to charge the same price or in some cases more for delivery service, they should accept the expectation for parallel dinning experiences.
author: Venney B.

description:
Good food. Legit spicy. Delivery came as estimated. Overall a solid option if you want Thai food delivered.

THE COST: $15.50 total for 2 entrees + 1 starter, delivered, shared between four people.

THE WAIT: Estimated 1 hour delivery at 8pm on a Saturday, came on time right around 9pm. 

THE FOOD:

* Egg rolls - 3.5 stars
Good crunch, pretty filling.

* Pad See Ew with beef - 3 stars
Solid, this was fine! Not too memorable. 

* Yellow Chicken Curry - 3 stars
We got medium spicy and this was very, very spicy! Otherwise chicken a bit dry.
author: Ziyan C.

description: Not sure if these guys know that we order delivery at least 1 a week. Love the Pad Thai and the Yellow Coconut Curry. Really fast service, friendly staff. Definitely a good choice for Thai food in the area given that there are so many choices.
author: Martin W.

description:
This place is interesting.  Server told me the original House of Thai on Larkin @ Geary is a family-owned business and this one is owned by a sister and her husband. ??? 

This one has a few things over the other location: it's in a much better, safer area with slightly better parking; the interior is smaller but way more comfortable and chill, and warmer both in decoration and actual temperature(!), and a hella lot less noisy, you can actually hear your dining partner's conversation (nice, unobtrusive, chill music in background); and one of the best things, unlike the original location, they have chicken satay on the menu!

Like the other location, service is generally good and the food comes out super fast after you order it.  Also like the other location, they have unusual drinks like homemade mint lemonade and lychee iced tea, along with Thai iced tea, which is good here (not always the case at some other Thai places).  Also, a lot of alcoholic items.

One slight drawback is that the portions seem smaller.  Aforementioned chicken satay has small pieces of chicken on the skewers and there are only 4 vs. the usual 5 or 6 at other places.  Also, the peanut sauce is "ok." Some places I've had it have been fantastic, some awful or flavorless, this is in the middle.  

I also tried the basic dish, Pad Thai.  Same as original location, the flavors were great and they use fresh pieces of tofu rather than frying it with the rest of the ingredients (making it rubbery), which makes a huge difference.  But, like the satay, a tad smaller portion than usual.

Really liked my efficient, friendly server (tall thin guy with glasses), and overall experience was good -- I'll definitely come back and try some other dishes.

Also, note that they aren't open til midnight like the one on Larkin.  10:30pm on Tues night I was there, which is still great compared to most other SF eateries, possibly open later on weekend nights.

Although not 5 stars, definitely solid.
author: Merrick W.

description: Very disgusting don't like the servers at all. They need to use hairnets everytime they cook or behind the counter or near the food when they are serving . I had the worst experience ever when I order my food here it's nasty and very unpleasant to see .
author: Arlene V.

description:
Had Toong Gyen Yung ( Golden Bag ) & Tom Kha
Spicy Coconut milk soup with lemongrass, galangal, kaffir Lime leaves, red&green onions, and straw mushroom which I poured over white rice - both were hot and delicious. They are always nice and it takes a very short time from when I ordered it to when it arrived!
author: sally s.

description:
I tried through Doordash delivery. 
I ordered Pad King (black fungus stir-fry) and Ka moo (pork leg stew). Sadly, they gave me the wrong dish: instead of pad king, they gave me pad prik king (green bean, pepper stir-fry), which was completely from the one I was expecting. 
The dish pad prik king (3/5) itself was on the oily side even when I requested for less oil. However, the dish was not bland. 
The ka moo was good (4.5/5)--the pork leg was pretty flavorful and juicy and the side bok choy and the picked veggies were delicious.
If they gave me the right dish and had less oil for the stir-fry, I will probably give 4 stars instead of 3 stars.
author: Clare L.

description:
Wow this was bad. Ordered delivery. First off, the khao mun gai. Khao means rice in Thai. There was no rice. I called and the restaurant was profoundly unhelpful. They said it's not supposed to have rice. Think about that for a second. If you know anything about Thai food, which I do since my parents are from Thailand, how can you have khao mun gai with no khao. But even worse is the order was water logged. Not gravy, not sauce. The chicken was swimming in water. They should call it "chicken in a glass of water...with extra water." 

Also ordered the Gui Chai appetizer which are the chive dumplings. They were cold, stale, and every dumpling had already fallen apart. It should be called the Chive Car Crash. They tasted like sadness, disappointment, and communism. 

I'll give this restaurant just one more chance. j/k...never again.
author: Esso S.

description:
I get takeout from here often, and I really never know what I am going to get. The spiciness levels vary extremely dramatically from day to day. I always stick with mild despite being someone who can handle high levels of spice, and sometimes even that is too much. 

Despite the inconsistencies in spiciness each day, I will continue to order from here. The food is delicious- the eggplant with tofu and basil is, without a doubt, the best item I have ordered from here. They do not skimp on the tofu and vegetables, and everything tastes fresh. I have ordered some soups, curries, and noodles from here as well, and they are also good, but nothing is quite as good as that eggplant. The rice plates are a perfect, filling portion of food, and only $10. 

I would recommend House of Thai 2 to anyone who is nearby and is craving decently priced Thai food, but it isn't worth traveling for!
author: Ayushi A.

description:
Their red curry blew me away, superb. As well, the egg rolls have a delicious flavor. Iceberg salad was without any discernible dressing, disappointing. Excellent soup of the day. 

First visit mostly positive, beautiful little space and the service was attentive. I'll definitely return for a big bowl of red curry, hope to find some other winners here. 

Their lunch special is $12, includes soup, salad, appetizer, rice and a small dish.
author: T J.

description: Their food is excellent!!! Everything was so flavorful and delicious! I was pleasantly surprised, Thai food has been hit or miss for me in the city lately and this definitely was a hit! I'd give 5 starts but the portions were on the small side, only downfall.
author: Ashley N.

description:
The hubby and I came here for lunch after finding out the Ramen place down the street wasn't open yet. We've only eaten Thai food once or twice, so we just guessed at what might be good. We ordered the seafood fried rice and a chicken plate with rice and sauce on the side. The fried rice was great and sort of reminded me of Peruvian food because of the onions, tomatoes mixed with the rice. My only complaint is the calamari was a little chewy, but overall a very flavorful dish. The chicken plate came with various pieces of chicken (both dark and white meat), and rice. Without the sauce it was very bland, so thank God there was something to give it life. Would not order that again. We also got two beers and the lychee sake. The latter I would not order again because it was too sweet.

The service was weird because the servers were all sitting at a table eating, so they rarely checked on us and it was hard to get the bill when we were done. Maybe they should come a little early so they can eat before opening? 

I would come back when in the area, but would definitely order different things next time.
author: Steph L.

description:
House of Thai 2 is my favorite spot for Thai takeout in the Lower Haight. It's not the best Thai food I've ever had, but it's affordable, easy to order online, and the food is pretty tasty. Just make sure you don't accidentally order from the original House of Thai in the Tenderloin.

My go-tos are the beef pad see-ew and the chan pad poo (basically a crab paid thai with egg). The portion on the latter is especially generous, and it feels like such a step up from your generic chicken pad thai. The noodles are a little oily, but to be perfectly honest, the oil just makes them that much more delicious.

Also, note, be careful with spice levels. When they say spicy, they really mean it.
author: Kelly R.

description: Came in for a casual dinner with some friends and that is exactly what we got! We ordered the pumpkin curry (delicious) pad kee mow (delicious) and the thai sausage (eh). Even though we only asked for medium spice, the food was on the spicy side so if you are not a fan of spice, I would recommend getting your food milder and asking for hot sauce on the side. Overall great value for money, good food and good location!
author: Rachel N.

description: I ordered the egg rolls and the pad kee mao (typically my favorite dish at other Thai restaurants) through Caviar. Egg roles were good - hot and crunchy. The pad kee mao though was way too salty / had WAY too much flavor (as crazy as it might sound). I'm surprised because I love salt and flavor but I couldn't even finish it. My mouth feels all weird and I'm super super thirsty now. Wouldn't recommend this dish if this is the way the typically cook this dish. Perhaps they messed up??
author: Alicia M.

description: I did thoroughly enjoy this restaurant. They had very nice scenery and the server staff there was very friendly and courteous. The food was also delicious. I ordered the Pineapple Fried Rice with shrimp, no cashew nuts, and no onions and I usually expect for there to be onions and cashews in it, but this place removed them all. They were very fast about our service, everything was clean and well organized. I really enjoyed my experience here and I would definitely return there with another date.
author: Tony T.

description:
Simply amazing food!! I can't think because of how great service and food was. I'm so super full but it's a good full. 
I highly recommend this place!
author: Rosa F.

description:
Very disappointed and frankly, disgusted! I don't care how fast you deliver, how polite you are or how good it tastes.. Once you find HAIR in your dish, it's over! And shame on me, as this was the second time our office ordered and found HAIR in our dish! I ordered for our entire office, thinking we would give them one more chance..  Never again! 
ZERO STAR.. Me and my entire office will never go back! 

Check out photos!
author: Anie L.

description: I love Thai food, but this spot missed the mark. The food was not good. I'm disappointed the food is so bad. The crab fried rice was over seasoned, The pad Thai noodles were overcooked, the Thai ice tea was mostly milk. Service could of also been better.
author: Jay J.

description: Parked nearby so thought I'd try this spot. I'm a big fan of kao soy - not all Thai restaurants serve it, and sometimes the ones that do only have it for lunch. It can vary greatly from restaurant to restaurant in terms of the noodles, broth, and toppings. Their kao soy is some of the best I've ever had! It came out steaming hot with a nice thick yellow curry sauce, thin egg noodles, and good amount of pickled mustard greens. Not too spicy. It was a large portion and I took half of it home. Based on that one dish, I would definitely come back here if I was in the neighborhood again and either order that again or try something different. Also I got a free Thai iced tea with check in.
author: Alissa A.

description: Standard Thai food. Service was fast and the menu is pretty big, nothing too special though. Was good for a quick lunch. I had the Khao Soi and I tried my friends Pad Thai, both not as flavorful as I had hoped, but it was also an under $15 meal.
author: Irene L.

description: Super fast delivery and the curry was great! I ordered medium and it was quite spicy so beware!
author: Joe H.

description: They forgot the orders of rice for our meal. Fine. Just send out delivery guy for the MISSING RICE...right? No. They want to charge back the rice so we just don't get rice with our curry. Also, the delivery guy was rude even after tipping him generously. Save your money, the food is not that good either.
author: Roy J.

description:
Got delivery from here last night - used Eat24. I preordered the day before and the restaurant was nice enough to call right away to ensure I meant to schedule it for the following day in stead of the current day. It arrived right on time, piping hot.

This is possibly the best pad thai I've had. The flavors were spot on, good portion, right spiciness, and good ingredients. My only complain is there did not seem to be any tofu, which on the menu it is listed as an ingredient. But better the tofu be forgotten than the shrimpies!

Second time I got food from here (ahem) my boyfriend messed up (he thinks it's Eat24's fault, but it definitely wasn't). He didn't add the chicken and veggies like I asked, which makes it wayyy better. The pad thai is super plain otherwise. So, i guess it's a pricy ordeal to make it tasty but hey #treatyoself every now and then.
author: Kelly G.

description: I went to the restaurant to pick up food and food was packed with paper bag and the food was heavy and I asked her plastic bag and she asked me 10 cent.but I don't have 10 cent and then I took food and after 2 minute the food fell down on my way..the waitress she is walking behind 10 cent and I lost 50 $ food...never want to go on this restaurant..if there is owner please try to tell your workers to behave nice to customers ..otherwise your business will go down n down ...
author: Khagen O.

description:
I've never eaten here before so can only talk about the takeout and delivery...I forget what the restaurant even looks like since it's been so long since I did takeout, but recently did a delivery order and remembered that I really do like the food here.

PAD THAI: it normally comes with shrimp but I substituted chicken for shrimp. I also requested no beansprouts and peanuts on the side and they made it perfectly.  It was some tasty pad thai that I wish I had more again. I ate up all the leftovers the next day too.  Might be one of my more favorite Pad Thais in the city? Not too sweet and not too fish sauce tasting.  And one thing I've noticed at some Thai restaurants, they're making their pad thai almost look pink.  Whatever that is, I don't care for it.  This one is not pink, thankfully.

KHAO MUN KAI: steamed chicken on garlic and ginger rice.  This one wasn't as good as Lers Ros (which comes with a soup broth and a soybean paste hot sauce which both are so good) but it was ok.  The rice was super flavorful and the chicken was cooked well.  But the hot sauce was on the oily side so it didn't do the same justice as Lers Ros.

EGGPLANT WITH CHICKEN: a little oily but really flavorful.  My only issue with this dish is there was so much chicken and not enough eggplant!

FREE DELIVERY over $20 through YelpEat24.  Woohoo.  And super fast too.
author: Traci H.

description:
In particular for Asian cuisine, there may be an inverse correlation between how good the food is and how good the menu's English is. Try this theory next time and let me know what you think... 

For this one, I was highly amused by the "friced rice" on the menu, so I had a good feeling about this restaurant. I got my favorite dish pad see ew and I thought it was one of the best ones I've had in a long time. The portion size was good, the flavor was exactly what I wanted (that slightly sweet but still very savory taste), and the noodles were cooked perfectly. I was pleased with the beef too (wasn't dry), but I probably could have used fewer stems from the broccoli.

The red curry is also tasty as well. I would have loved to get some roti and dip it in the red curry sauce.

The wall behind me where I was sitting had some flies though. I was a bit unhappy about that. Also there is an automatic 18% gratuity added on for a party of 5 or more, which to be honest isn't really that many people. Usually the number is 6 or higher (or even around 8).
author: Danielle C.

description: Put it this way:  I had the salmon curry on Sunday night.  It's now Friday morning and I still have diarrhea.  On day two of antibiotics so hopefully it'll sort out soon.  I remember thinking the salmon seemed like it was packaged, and not wild/fresh.  I have friends that eat here all the time and say they've never had any issues and they love it, so I guess I was unlucky.
author: Jason H.

description: Ordered food to go and were pleasantly surprised. The food was great and much quicker than estimated .
author: Ilya K.

description: We ordered delivery from this place and was not satisfied. Our order consisted of Pad Woon Sen with beef, Roti with curry sauce, and Pad Prik King with chicken. The noodle dish was fine, but had very tough and chewy beef strips in it. :( The Roti and curry sauce were nice, but was ridiculously priced for what we got. It was $7-$8 appetizer that arrived looking more like $3-4 worth of food. Finally, the best item we received was the Pad Prik King. The dish was perfectly spiced and smelled amazing.
author: Lisa R.

description: Stop by here for late dinner. Fast and friendly service. For taste, it is okay for typical Thai food in San Francisco.
author: Victoria P.

description: We had dinner delivered to the Mission.  It took about 40 minutes to arrive, faster than the countdown that the Yelp ordering app gives you.  They called us to let us know the tom yum noodle soup I asked to be not spicy could not be made "not spicy."  When it arrived and I put the soup together, I found it to be quite salty and heavy.  My boyfriend had the cashew chicken at the second highest level of spiciness that you can order.  He is able to handle spice, and he had a hard time eating this.  The papaya salad had a lot of cabbage and was not too pleasant tasting - just very heavy on the fish sauce and acidity.  I like that they deliver and have the dishes I like, that we found were not really available at the other Thai restaurants in the city that deliver, but sadly, the food was just all right.
author: Christina G.

description: My favorite Thai in the neighborhood, it's my regular go to for take out or a casual bite out. I love it.
author: Nancy K.

description: Large portion of delicious Pad Thai for only $10. Server was very friendly and the environment in the restaurant was nice.
author: Emma J.

description:
Mm mm! My mouth is watering just thinking about this place!

Their food was so yummy! Lots of different noodle dishes, rice dishes, soups, etc. all to choose from. They also have some beers and their thai tea was amazing!

We had a few dishes, pad thai, pad see ew, pad kee mao, all of which were delicious! Some of the dishes came with a spicy warning, but they were happy to accomodate and make it less spicy for you.

The place is pretty small and cozy so I imagine some nights there is a wait! But the staff are all really nice and friendly so they make you feel welcome.

The restaurant itself is pretty hot inside, so make sure if you dress warm you layer down so you can stay cool in there. It also is pretty clean and nice for a hole in the wall, but keep in mind, it's still a hole in the wall with that hole in the wall feeling... especially in the bathroom...

One more downfall was that the plate were deceptively large. There really wasn't as much food as the plate should have been able to hold. But it still filled me and the guys up.
author: Elysia M.

description: We go here every other week! It's authentic and quick- finally someone takes the wish "make it spicy seriously" Tom Yum and Tom Kha are legendary. So is the Pad Thai
author: Josephine L.

description: The pumpkin curry is the best! This is my favorite Thai food restaurant in SF!!! We usually order to go but the place is cozy and the staff is nice.
author: Silmarie N. M.

description: First time really trying Thai but my husband and I really liked it. Cute little place. Quick friendly service and a nice menu
author: Jessica D.

description:
Great little spot with a very relaxing atmosphere. The table tops are nice with a long bench with pillows for sitting. The restaurant was very quiet when I went for lunch, the food was reasonably priced, and the quantity of food was great. 

They offer a checkin special for a complimentary Thai iced tea, which was amazing and sweet like I'd expect. I also ordered the yellow curry with chicken and brown rice. The food was great and the portions were very generous. I'll definitely stop back next time I'm walking through the Haight.
author: Mike D.

description: I've been ordering delivery from this restaurant for a couple years and it was a favorite. Lately, I've noticed that the quality of their food has gone way down. When calling to ask and request items be replaced, the restaurant has acknowledged they have new suppliers, but has been unapologetic about the poor quality. Tonight, I ordered delivery for two and the food was just terrible. Called the restaurant about missing items and items that were not edible. They wouldn't deliver new food or refund the items. Ended up calling the delivery service and they were able to help some (one item was refunded). But I will not be ordering from them again going forward.
author: M B.

description: Great spot for quick takeout! Ordered the Green Curry with chicken and it surpassed my expectations. It was a great portion size, very flavorful and took only 10 minutes for pickup. Would  highly recommend and will definitely eat here again!
author: Stephanie T.

description: My roommate and I ordered House of Thai delivery and its very solid. I wouldn't say anything over the top with flavors or variety, but the food was hot and good when it was delivered and it helped with my craving of Thai food. I'm still searching for that top Thai delivery or takeout place!
author: Brandon P.

description: Got my order wrong , one item did not show up correctly and some other seafood salad thing was put in instead of larb salad  . Forgot my rice for curry , granted it was new years but rice should of been checked . Great curry tho
author: Brandi S.

description: One of the best Thai restaurants in the city. I've been to Thailand and this Thai House 2 is VERY close in taste to the food I had while I was there. Love their Pad See Ew!
author: Steve W.

description: I hate to add this update but the past couple of times I have ordered from House of Thai 2 have been less than stellar. I got a bit sick after last time. I gave them another shot today. I bit into the Por Pier Pak (veggie egg roll) and crunched down on something that felt like a rock. I spit out my food to find a couple of small (what I can only describe as) rock fragments. Definitely not edible. And I'm lucky I didn't crack a tooth. Sorry to say goodbye (at least for now) House of Thai. :(
author: Carson S.

description:
Put in an order on yelp because after 10 hours of travelling (on Air Canada=no good food) I was famished! Easy ordering and quick delivery. 

Portions were amazing sizes (we ate the pad thai for 3 meals) and full of flavor. Was it the best thai food I've had? No, but did it trump most of the 3.5 starts in Toronto, yes!

The fried tofu with the sweet chili sauce was one of my favorites and came with 6 large pieces. 

We also got the papaya salad which makes my mouth water thinking about it right now because it was spicy, fishy and crunchy :) All very important in a thai papaya salad! 

Definitely hit the spot and was very convenient and tasty!
author: Jannies L.

description: I came here after Bay to Breakers and it as just what the doctor ordered. Free thai iced tea with check in! The red curry and pad kee mao were on point.
author: Jane H.

description:
Papaya Salad is killing here. 
Also 10stars spicy larb
And glass noodle spicy salad 

Ps. They have one TV here.
author: Fah Z.

description: Visited SF from out of town and was looking for a new food experience. I never tried Thai cuisine but decided to try it out here. And let me just say I and my bf were not disappointed. The atmosphere on a Thursday night was quiet, dim light and romantic. The food was packed full of flavor and the green tea ice cream was very delicious. We will be coming back when we are back in town!
author: Psychedelic A.

description: For an appetizer, my boyfriend and I shared the Larb--so good! Just like my mom makes it at home. We ordered everything as spicy as possible and they weren't kidding, the Thai chilis and peppers are nostalgic to me and painfully good. We were thinking of a specific steamed fish dish win lime and chili peppers but didn't know the name, but our waiter was so helpful in figuring out what we wanted. The fish was steamed to perfection and the meat was perfectly marinated in lime, garlic and chili--very authentically Thai and so simple and delicious.  Would recommend this place to any Thai-food lover!
author: Faith L.

description: My go to lunch spot! Food is always delicious and ready fast. Hard to not order from here everyday
author: Angelina Lola P.

description:
I was not expecting such varied reviews! It sounds like most of them have been for poor delivery and takeout experiences. Y'all need to try getting off the couch and dining here in person sometime.

I've eaten at House of Thai 2 many times for dinner. I love the setup of the dining area, it's a great date spot. There are wooden booths built into the sides of the walls with huge cushy pillows. It's fun to sidle up next to your SO and sit together on the pillow side.

More recently, I think they've done some redecorating as far as the wall decals are concerned, with scenes of South East Asia. The decor has always been great but I think this was a cool addition.

House of Thai 2 has great food and is reasonably priced, it's definitely one of the best places to get Thai food within a mile radius (as well as Lers Ros). My SO and I ate here last night and for two entrees, an appetizer, and two beers each, it was $45, not including tip. 

Beer is $3 and Wine is $5 during their Happy Hour. The "Golden Bags" appetizer is a must, they are crunchy stuffed deep fried wontons that come with a sweet onion and cucumber dipping sauce. They are crunchy, crisp, and not greasy in the least. We also ordered the Kao Soy, which comes with the small/medium flat egg noodles and the Duck Rice plate (don't remember the name). Both dishes were rich and flavorful, very filling, and a delight to consume. I've also had success with the Tom Kha, Pad Thai, and curries in the past. Basically every time I come here I am willing to try something different, just because everything is so good at the atmosphere is so pleasant.

The servers here are very accommodating and friendly, I have never had anything less than stellar service.
author: Megan D.

description: Three weeks ago my car was parked in front of the restaurant, and they had a family party until 3:30am. One of their family members went out and start throwing bottles on people because he was drunk and cracked my windshield. I saw the guy, but I was concerned for my life, and three of their neighbors are witnessing that he cracked my windshield. The second day I went to the restaurant, and they know that their family member brook my windshield, but they told me that they're going to call him and figure out something. I went back and fourth a hundred times, and they always tell me he's not picking up the phone. Until today he's still not picking up the phone my car is brand new the windshield will cost $1500. My deductible is $1000 dollars because it's a special type.
author: Mohamed A.

description: Very solid family-run Thai restaurant. Started out with beef larb and tom kau soup and the Chan Pad Poo (Dungeness crab with rice noodles) for entrée. All were very good and the service was quick.
author: Paul S.

description: The food is tasty here.  I ordered the House of Thai Noodles. It came with thick flat noodles and some ground chicken.  It was good but it needed more ground chicken. I felt it was skimpy.  I also ordered the Gai Kra Pow with brown rice.  It's a nice dish (maybe they use more oil than I'd prefer) but tasty.  The delivery was quick. It arrived sooner than I had expected.
author: Manny Y.

description:
I'm so confused by the inconsistency of this place. I've dined in twice - both the food and service have been great and deserves 4 stars. 

Delivery on the other hand is a completely different story. I've ordered several times from House of Thai 2 using the Yelp eat24 app and the food and delivery service has been absolutely terrible. All the delivery people are super lazy and don't bother with buzzing my front door so I can let them into my building (included in my delivery instructions). Instead, I get very rude phone calls to come downstairs to pick up my food from the street. One time, my friendly pug ran out to greet the delivery guy, he snaps at me and tells me he is super busy and has three other deliveries after me. Chill the F out, it literally only took an extra second of his time to let my dog say hi. Extra spicy pad see ew = no spice pad see ew. Also portions sizes are half what you get dining in at the restaurant.

Honestly not going to order from here any more, and if I do, I'm not going to feel bad/guilty about not tipping the crappy delivery guy.

TLDR; dine-in pretty good, delivery is shit.
author: Lauren T.

description: Reliably delicious, very fast, great for takeout or sit down. They also have young coconuts! One of my consistent go-to places.
author: C Y.

description: Place is ok.  I asked for medium spice and they made waaaaaaaay way too spicy.  People In the room at the same time i was eating eyes watering up...
author: Chris T.

description: Portions were small but the food was good I might order from here again
author: Lennie G.

description: I've been ordering their Pad Thai for delivery quite frequently and it's always so delicious! I add beef and make it extra spicy!
author: Dorothy T.

description:
After an amazing night at Nightlight Academy of the Sciences we were hungry for real food. Apparently, cocktails and science increases appetites! Who knew. After Yelping for a few minutes, we narrowed it down to Thai food and headed to the Haight. Great last minute decision to get take out from House of Thai 2. Within 10 minutes our food was ready for pick up. When we got home and were ready to scarf it down, it was still hot enough for the noodles to burn my lips. Awesome.

We both went pretty simple. My partner chose the pad kee mao with chicken and ordered it extra hot. They were true their word, he was sweatin' on the couch and loving his dish. Ha. I ordered the pad see ew the noodles weren't too flat and thick, but still great texture and flavor. I asked for medium spice, but it seems they forgot all the spice. No worries. I added it at home and squeezed some lime to make it perfect for me. 

Overall, the quick decision to get Thai and be really satisfied on a Thursday night made me happy and then I went to sleep.
author: Priti K.

description: i am a regular customer, but they have lost 5 customers as that is how many people i ordered FOR today.... this place forgot to add shrimp, so we called to ask for our money back, since we were chaged extra and he chastised us about the amount of tip given to the driver and that because we went through eat24, even though we tipped through our credit card, that eat24 does not tip the driver and that we don't respect their drivers. please do not go to this place, he was rude and did not provide any resolution for their error and then tried to make their choice to use eat24 our issue.  we will neverrrr deliver from them again!
author: Rakita O.

description:
We came in early on a Friday night, and the place was relatively empty so we were seated immediately. I wasn't expecting anything great because of the varied reviews on Yelp, but was pleasantly surprised.

From the outside, it looks like it might be another hole in the wall, but the ambiance inside is very soothing, and calm. They keep the lights relatively dim, and the decor is consistent. Our waitress was extremely attentive the entire time, and would fill up our water without being prompted.

We shared the Tom Yum soup (mild), yellow curry w/ brown rice & beef (mild), and the pad thai.
When the Tom Yum first came out, I was extremely skeptical, but it tasted great. Super flavorful, and at first I thought there were only mushrooms and tomatoes, but found the shrimp at the bottom. There was also a lot more than I thought because it came out in bowl rather than the typical "hot pot" serving dish you find at other Thai restaurants.

The yellow curry with beef was only okay. It may have been our fault for getting brown rice with the dish, but it was bland, and wasn't mind blowing. However, on the other hand, the pad thai was amazing. My friend and I both agreed that was the dish of the night, and I would gladly go back simply to have the pad thai again.
author: Julia Z.

description: We love getting House of Thai 2 delivered. I love their pad thai and pumpkin curry. They can make both gluten free. Their pad pri king is also delicious.
author: Jillian M.

description: Gross. Bit into something powdery on my stir fried eggplant dish and spit it out right away. Smelled like bleach or Ajax or something chemical. I told the waitress and she got defensive. Horrible experience. It smelled bad in there and was pretty dirty. Don't even waste your time coming here.
author: Chase C.

description:
Ordered delivery online 5pm on a Wednesday. Arrived 40 minutes later, still hot, reasonably priced and utterly delicious. Generous portions, good quality meat, fluffy rice and flavorful well-balanced curry.

My new go-to Thai delivery methinks.
author: Excelsus S.

description: No complaints at all. Ordered it to go- food was ready within 35 mins. The price- unbeatable for being in the city and having a 4 star rating. The pad thai dish is only $10! And don't even get me started on the fried honey bananas- just pure deliciousness. For the people below complaining about the service- this is a Thai restaurant with cooks who speak broken English- what do you expect? Go back to Pac Heights & find an overly priced fine dining experience if you'd rather ;)
author: Rob M.

description:
(ubereats)

Moderate portion sizes (which is usually good, but can be bad if you're hungry!) and decent "classic Thai-American fare". Pad-see ew does its job well enough.
author: B H.

description: I ate here for the second time last night. The first time I got the "pad se ew" and it was so delicious! It was all I could think about on vacay so I really wanted to try more of the menu when I returned. When I returned I got the "tom kha soup" and the "por pier pak". I got the soup because I was feeling a little under the weather and was really craving it. I have to say that the soup was spicy enough to burn my throat, and the soup didn't taste anything like what I'm used to eating when ordering "tom kha ". As for the second item, aka, fried spring rolls . They were very dry and had a lot pepper in them. Overall both items were very disappointing and very over priced for what I had received.
author: Jeremiah C.

description:
While the food was fine, the whole experience was unpleasant. The waitresses are extremely impersonal. On top of that, we awkwardly waited for our last dish (which was an appetizer and should've been out first) till we were ready to leave. Lame.

They just give the impression that they don't feel like doing anything extra to satisfy the customer, not even a smile.

Overall was just unpleasant. If I decide to eat their food again, I will call in an order for pick up and that's a BIG IF.
author: Mike M.

description:
The best delivery Thai food in SF.

The best pineapple fried rice anywhere!
author: Gracie L.

description: They have good sized portions, take reservations, and are well priced for the city. It's consistent and reliable but not bad.
author: Bianca E.

description: Read a few reviews and decided to give it a shot.  The Gang Dang was very flavorful, a good mix of sweet, savory and spicy.  Easy to get to and very quick to deliver food.  Good for a first dining experience in SF
author: John H.

description: Be careful. These guys fucked up an order tonight, so we had a bunch of teachers who didn't get dinner before Back to School Night. I've eaten here before and the food was good, but check that they got your order right before you accept delivery. I'll give you guys the benefit of the doubt and assume the person who took the phone call is new at the job, but I'm not ordering here again. I'm hungry :(
author: Alex W.

description:
*finally a decent thai place in lower haight* 
[kamoo, do it]
[simpletastydelicious]

After a few management changes here, i think we have a winner. I've only lived here over 2 years and I think this is the 3rd management change I've seen and totally for the better. Nothing fancy or different about this place but just good Thai food that's not too salty, not too spicy, and great portions. 

Ingredients are all fresh and the wait staff is always friendly. Lower Haight doesn't usually have the best ethnic cuisine but this is by far the best Thai place in this area.
author: Kevin T.

description:
Definitely very respectable Thai food. You can find better... BUT... they have fair prices... they deliver to the Castro... and the last time they delivered it was ridiculously fast... like... 14 minutes from order to doorbell.\

So yeah, totally the best delivery option around, and always satisfied.
author: Sean B.

description: Consistently some of the best Thai food I've had in or outside of Thailand. Delivery is fast and so hot when you get it that I almost burned my tongue. My go to is the pumpkin curry, garlic rice and pad Thai. I don't usually order pad Thai--so ordinary--but theirs is so fresh. The garlic rice is so good I could eat it alone.
author: Laurel S.

description: Just had three dishes delivered. Portion size was extremely small and did not include adequate ingredients. For example, our pineapple fried rice dish did not include pineapple!!!
author: jay l.

description: I've been ordering food from this place for some time and it is always a delight. I particularly love their yellow curry.
author: Guillaume R.

description:
I lived in BKK for a year and got really into the street food there and I got to House of Thai 2 over all other Thai food for the authentic taste. Love their flavors and selection. 

I recommend the chicken rice (Kau Man Gai), the Tom Yam Noodle soup, and the duck (Ped Yang) a la carte. Wash everything down with a Chang beer. Welcome to Thailand.
author: Adam B.

description:
Food taste like authentic Thai food for most dishes. It is ok but not spectacular. 

Papaya in papaya salad are in big chunks. It has fermented crab smell. Dried shrimps are so tiny that I almost think that there aren't any.

Sai oou does not have a lot of herb aroma. I would say it is close enough to the ones you can get in Thailand.

Catfish larb is bizarre. The fish is deep fried which it should be grilled like what you can get in Thailand. I guess deep fried can get rid of the fishy smell better than grilling.

Service is ok. Food does not come out at the same time. Table is not very clean and sticky.
author: Nat W.

description:
Really happy with our delivery. The spice and flavors were great and delivery was 20min ahead of schedule. 
We'll be ordering from here often.
author: Tasha A.

description: Pad see ew was delicious which I would definitely recommend on order in il especially if your not sure what you would like to eat. My mom ordered the fried chicken rice plate the chicken was well cooked but very bland had no flavoring what so ever so I'm guessing that's why they added the sweet & sour sauce on the side. The Thai iced tea was pretty good  also. Don't forget to check in so you an get your free Thai iced tea!
author: Vanessa D.

description: Just got an order of pad Thai take out. It was super dry - the noodles were undercooked and there wasn't enough sauce on the noodles. And what they call shrimp was a joke. So tiny and only 3 of them.   Perhaps one of the worst pad Thai's I've had in recent memory. So sad. Place used to be good.
author: reza n.

description:
I'm not too familiar with Thai food but this place was great. It was very quiet for a Saturday afternoon lunch--most of the tables were empty, only 2-3 groups there at any given time. Food came out quickly after it was ordered. I would tell you what I ordered but honestly I can't remember what it was called.

My only complaint was that even though we ordered everything with medium spice, one of the dishes came out extremely spicy. For a group that can handle a lot of spice to say that means it was pretty spicy.
author: Catherine C.

description: this thai place is better than the others in the vacinity, in my experience. When i ask for 5/5 thai spicy, they don't just pour Sriracha all over my food like other places do. the veggies are fresh and crisp.  Kao Pad Gaeng Khew Fried Rice is great, the pad kee mao is awesome too, but just a little on the oily side.
author: Adam R.

description:
We love this place! It's close to our house and sometimes when we are feeling lazy (hungover) we get delivery. BF swears by the pumpkin curry and I love the curry steamed egg noodles or rad na. They even call you if they think you might have placed a wrong detail on your order. 

Delivery is fast and reliable, good for Sunday nights, and the service is good. Also medium spicy is a good spicy if you can take it, spicy is like (FIYAAAAAA). As in, once I had to order while I ate in 4 different beverages to combat the spicyness. I'd stick to medium.
author: Christina L.

description:
Great food
Great taste
Great prices 

No parking

P.S. Eat chicken coconut soup. Bad. Ass.
author: James M M.

description:
After a few weeks of living in the neighborhood, House of Thai 2 has already become my go-to for Thai food. I ordered the pumpkin (kabocha) curry the first time I went, and I've been craving it regularly ever since. It comes packed with vegetables and your choice of protein, and for $1 extra you can add eggplant. It's super flavorful and satisfying. Service here is also great! 

I've placed an order for pickup before, and it was super fast - I got there twenty minutes after I ordered through OrderAhead, picked up my food, and was out the door in less than a minute.
author: Abby S.

description:
Delivery order review.

First, food came FAST - 40 minutes, which is awesome! Major props to them for that.

We got 8 dishes across 7 of us, so I feel like we got a pretty good sample.

The dishes we had where:
*Paid thai (x2) mild
*Pad graw pa with chicken rice plate, medium
*Pad prik king with chicken a la carte, medium
*Pad prik king with chicken rice plate, medium
*Pad ma keur, medium
*Gang dang with duck, medium
*Pad kee mao with chicken, medium

I'd say everything was "fine", but nothing really stood out. Like a few others have mentioned, the spice level is higher than other Thai restaurants, so even the medium dishes had a decent (certainly not overwhelming) amount of kick. The dishes are consistently pretty oily, which might be what I expected given the relatively low price tags, but still disappointing. The best dish was probably the pad ma keur, probably because it seemed to have the least amount of oil.

FYI the rice plate portion is about ~2/3 of the a la carte, so if you're able to make rice at home, a la carte is a relatively better deal.

I consider the delivery quality on par with Thai 4 You, so I'd be equally happy ordering from House of Thai 2 or Thai 4 You instead.
author: Rohan N.

description:
It's with deep regret I write a negative review for House of Thai 2.

The food remains extremely delicious and flavorful, but I've gotten sick from eating there the last 3-4 times I've been. I even tried the original location in the Tenderloin once more and got sick from there also.  I am not sure if they have some cleanliness issues, but I can't eat there for awhile.
author: Ravi R.

description: This is my standby thai place. So consistent they never let me down. Can't go wrong with the pad thai or red chicken curry. Get a side of the garlic rice with your curry.
author: Ross R.

description:
We came here for dinner during a trip to San Francisco after spending a day touring the Mission District. The food was hit or miss but the overall experience was good enough for me to be able to recommend a stop here if  you want some decent Thai food.

The spring rolls were tasty although a bit drenched in oil. Unfortunately it was only served with standard duck sauce which takes away from the flavor of the appetizer.

The pad prik king with pork was delicious and authentically spicy. The pork was crispy and the sauce was delicious and the serving size was large enough to fill me up even after going a whole day without food. I'd definitely recommend this dish.

However, the same could not be said for the pad woon sen. The noodles were overcooked and dry and the whole dish just didn't have adequate flavor. 

The Thai iced tea was pretty standard. I liked that it wasn't too sweet and helped alot with the spiciness of the pad prik king.
author: Russell M.

description:
This has become my new go-to Thai delivery spot. I've never had anything bad here and delivery always comes within the promised delivery window. 

Some of what I've tried:
- Som Tom papaya salad with fresh shrimp: amazing!
- Pad Thai: some of the best I've ever had
- Pad Gra Praw: delicious but if you ask for spicy it will be SPICY
- Yum Woon Sen Salad: was a little dry but maybe just not something to get delivered

Definitely worth trying. So good.
author: Alana R.

description:
First time ordering and we were really happy with dinner.  Terrific Pad Thai. Exceptionally tasty pumpkin curry and yellow curry chicken.

We've ordered several time since with the same level of quality.
author: Kirsti A.

description: The staff wasn't very attentive. The tom kah soup was way too salty and gave me incredible heart burn. My friend had pineapple rice. He liked it, but it was kind of plain. I won't eat here again.
author: R D.

description: Pad se ew is good! Portion is small. That's the only item I ordered to go. However, they did not allow me to claim my free Thai ice tea with to go order.
author: Gloria T.

description: Good food, still warm after delivery. I'm a little sad they didn't have mango and sticky rice as a dish, but I just ordered the sticky rice and cut my own mango. Decent place.
author: Anna T.

description: Whoa....order mild noodles and arrived super spicy!    I enjoy spicy food but for ordering mild, the spice was definitely on the closer side to hot.  I'd hate to see what medium or hot is.
author: Doug R.

description: I really enjoy this restaurant. I eat from there about once a week. It is about three blocks from my apartment. I usually call in and pickup the order myself. They are nice to me and the food is good.
author: Daniel T.

description: Good Thai restaurant with excellent prices and good service! Dishes came fast and pretty enough for a person.
author: Ricardo Kenji K.

description: Delicious green curry.  The spicy is verrry spicy so be warned, a lot of red pepper flakes.
author: Cole D.

description: Went here on a Saturday for dinner.  Food was good, service was friendly but extremely slow and not very attentive.  Ordered the curry fried rice, which is not very good but it did come with a mini serving of cucumber salad.  Ordered the red curry and that was quite flavorful.  Ordered the Pad Kee Mao, also good but their mild would be equivalent to medium at most Thai places.  The portion sizes for the noodle dish was smaller than most places.  Quite place, the booth we sat in had pillows.  Cute and all, but not exactly comfortable.  I'm smaller than my friend and I didn't enjoy the pillows too much, he on the other had had to remove it to be more comfortable.  Would come back, maybe just to get food to go...most of their patrons were getting to go.  The place however had a consistent flow of people coming in to dine.
author: Anh N.

description:
My husband and I go here 1 - 2 times a week. We LOOOVVEEEE this place!!!!!!
Everything on their menu is bomb - noodle dishes, curry, entrees, EVERYTHING! Definitely try their drinks - especially the Thai Iced tea - sooo good can't get enough of it. Their desserts are amazing too. The staff is SUPER SUPER friendly!

The food is amazing. Highly recommended.
author: Lina S.

description:
Delivery took an hour and 35 min! The estimated time was 45-60 min. 

The food was decent but I was so hangry by the time it came, no level of extraordinary taste could redeem it.

Sorry Thai House 2, I'll be trying someplace new next time. Good thing there are a ton of other Thai restaurants in this city!
author: Ariel M.

description: They get an OK. It's still not Little Thai but it's close and better than Marnee. The positives: Nice setting and pleasant staff. The cons: Portions were small, about 1 and 1/2 cups per ala carte items. Rice was extra charge and determining why proved to be difficult. Just bring a family sized dish of rice with a table, bigger tables bring more. Yellow curry was spicy, it is supposed to be the mildest but needed much more coconut milk. The duck salad was too salty, and didn't have enough mint and cilantro. Might be back but not likely, still looking for somewhere to replace Little Thai in San Francisco.
author: Nick W.

description: There are many Thai restaurants in San Francisco but I recommend this restaurant because the food was delicious, the ambience was wonderful, and prices were great! I came here with a large group of friends and they were able to accommodate all 10 of us. I also recommend trying their Thai iced tea!
author: Angelica A.

description: We got the egg rolls and green curry delivered. The rolls were good, and the curry was tasty, but the tofu in my curry had gone a bit sour, which isn't the most appetizing.
author: Aubrey B.

description: The pumpkin curry is solid, 4-5 stars solid. So why the 2 star rating? When I request (and pay for) extra ingredients, they ignore me. Tonight for example, I ordered pumpkin curry with tofu + extra tofu. Should be a lot of tofu, no? Three pieces. Three.
author: Alex L.

description:
Probably the best Pad Woo-sen I have ever had. Tasted fresh and deep flavors. The shrimp tasted fresh as well and very clean.

My boyfriend had the Pad Woo-Sen. He's normally a Pad Thai guy, but said he would order that again so it must be good. I wouldn't know though, we didn't leave any extra for the other to try : )
author: Megan V.

description:
Good food, environment quite cute. Service awful. The waitress was awfully unpleasant. 
Not sure I'll come back.
author: Swann F.

description:
Went for lunch. The cuisine was Below average with quality of food and ingredients for the price. The service was slow, Had to ask thrice for a glass of water. 
Order green curry with jasmine rice and lemonade. Curry was just green beans and few slices of chicken. 
Lemonade was thick slurry of sugar with slice of lime and few mint Leaves. 
Decor was okay for the neighborhood.
author: Karan B.

description:
I would like to give this restaurant a good review for delivery, taste of food, or excellent service on the phone... Sadly, marks on all accounts is low.
 A. Delivery was quite slow... I purposely chose a place close to home... Still, it was an unreasonable time for delivery (more that 2 hours). 
 B. The spring roll was soggy and smelled musty... and it lacked any type of flavor
     except the sweetness of sugar and oil gone bad. I ordered yellow chicken curry which barely had any chicken. Added vegetables to it and they were definitely over cooked and mushy. My soup was spicy sure but completely too sweet and only three tiny shrimp. Bad thai food tries to mask itself with so much sugar... It's very un-Thai... This place is definitely practicing this. Just saw the THREE food poisoning review.. 

  Hoping it does not happen to me, would not be surprised if it does.
author: Gari C.

description:
Great little Thai spot in the Lower Haight. Clean interior with an open kitchen if you want to watch these magicians craft your Pad Thai. Chicken was nice and moist, perfect amount of spice, and served expeditiously. Thai iced tea was delicious without being super sweet. Staff friendly, welcoming, and happy to suggest their favorite picks. 

Most dishes are priced under $10 making eating here a weekly occurrence.
author: Ryan R.

description:
House of Thai is too good to be pigeonholed into the tired 'friendly neighborhood Thai takeout place' trope. Their mothership in the Tenderloin is a destination Thai restaurant, and the food at this location is just as delicious. 

I usually get one of the curries. The tender and savory pumpkin variant is the standout, though they're all pretty stellar.

Their tom yum and tom kha are both very solid; delicately-spiced with a ton of mushrooms. The flank steak salad, while super simple -- basically just lettuce, onions, and steak -- is also quite good. 

All of the dishes are very well-priced. The $9 curry rice plates are one of the best dinner deals in the Lower Haight.

They get a lot of delivery/take-out volume, but the ambiance and service are nice enough to merit a sit-down meal.

Their interpretation of 'spicy' is a little more aggressive than other Thai places in SF. If you're on the fence, go one level less spicy than you normally would.
author: Ryan D.

description: Very nice staff. I ordered a chicken dish that was served as ground chicken, I didn't realize it was served both as ground chicken and sliced chicken. They were very sweet about getting me what I wanted after I was served. That kinda service shouldn't go unnoticed. I appreciate that.
author: Angelica K.

description: Seriously some of the best Thai in the city! I eat here all the time -nearly once a week. The Pad Thai is awesome, pad kee Mao, crispy pork, the soups, duck curry, golden bags.....literally everything I've had is delicious. And I'm often trying new things. Great service too and reasonable prices! Eat here. Trust me.
author: VM T.

description:
This location has been a few different Thai food restaurants over the years, and this one is the best yet.
I wish they had Panang Curry, but the pumpkin curry is good as well.
author: Haley K.

description:
As a local neighborhood joint, HoT2 is great.  It may not be the best thai food in town, but it's consistently 'pretty good', reasonably priced (especially compared to other locations in the neighborhood), quick, and the service is great. 

I recommend it if you're in the Lower Haight, and looking for Thai food.
author: Adam W.

description:
So, in terms of food, we ordered in the Pad Se Ew with beef, Tom Kha soup, the appetizer combo and the Gang ga pee. 

Make sure if you are picking your spicyness, always go with mild; we picked medium for the pineapple fried rice, it's as if someone dumped a bunch of peppers over it. We couldn't eat it.

The noodles and beef tasted kinda burnt. (Still haven't tried the soup yet). 

I did enjoy the curry though, nice and had the right amount of spicyness.

The appetizers were alright, some eggrolls, buns, patties and fried tofu.

What probably really affects my review is the delivery. We ordered through Eat24 and everything alright. However, the delivery boy, after giving me the food, stands there and says how the payment isn't incomplete.

I had paid with my card through eat24. I told him, and he was being really secretive. I was just as confused. 

Then, I realized he wanted a tip which I hadn't included. 

Ok, I'm not against tipping, but it's pretty weird for someone to stand around and hint at a tipping, he could have just been straightforward with me. 

But I gave him a few dollars anyway, but it was a very awkward experience. Don't think I'll order from here.
author: Bahar A.

description: I've come here maybe 10 times out of convenience. I usually get some permutation of stir fry noodles with chicken and veggies. Asking for spicy is pleasant, but a bit oily. Reliably decent, better than most random diner tier Thai places. The staff can be hit or miss
author: Steve T.

description:
Late night dinner with a large group. We had been drinking at Fly before getting dinner. The restaurant was very accommodating to our group especially since they were closing soon. We were the only customers, thus our food came out super fast.

We ordered a plate of spring rolls, 2 duck over fried rice dishes, curry with chicken, everything fried rice and soup. Everyone tasted each other food and the overwhelming consensus was that the food was great. 

I would recommend if you are looking for a late night spot that accommodates large groups.
author: Djuan S.

description: Sad to give them a low review, their food is decent. Previously, enjoyed timely deliveries...until tonight. Ordered via Eat24, order estimate was 75 minutes (already long). Order arrived at the 105 minute mark. Food was cold. My Pra ram contained 5 pieces of tofu (a minuscule amount) and an abundance of lettuce. Tried calling the listed number - was sent straight to voicemail. Talked to Eat24, who claimed to have called the restaurant to discuss my issue. Allegedly HoT2 said that they would not do anything to rectify the issue. Seeing as their service tonight was so terrible, I will not be going back.
author: Ashley M.

description: Great food, service was fast and good. Not too expensive. Will definitely be back! The house of wings put the closing sign up as we were walking and luckly ended up at the Thai place by chance. Best plan B ever, thumbs up!
author: Eu W.

description: It's a little bit of a hole in the wall but this is honestly the best Tom Kha I've ever had!
author: Allison G.

description:
My friends and I were in the area and looking for anywhere to eat. We happen to stumble upon House of Thai 2 and were so pleasantly surprised! They had the Warrior game on so we got to enjoy our Thai food while watching the game in a quieter setting than a bar. 

I ordered the equivalent of the Yellow curry and it was incredible!! Flavored to perfection. We also checked in and got free Thai iced teas which was an awesome perk. 

Service was seemingly lightening fast. I felt like I ordered and the food came out immediately after. I've had a lot of Thai food in my day and his was among the best!
author: Ali G.

description: Editing my review. This place has no consistency for spiciness. Last night my pad Thai was so spicy that I couldn't eat it. I called and whoever I spoke with told me it was my fault cause I ordered it mild and mild means spicy. He was so rude. He told me to look up mild in the dictionary and that it means with spice. I will not be going back because at this point, 1 out of 3 orders is just completely inedible for me.
author: Cathy L.

description:
This is quickly becoming our regular takeout spot. The laarb (one of my fave Thai dishes) is really good. Often SE Asian dishes mix up a little sugar with heir fish sauce and this place doesn't use too much sugar in the laarb so the roasted rice/lime flavors really shine through. 

I love the pumpkin curry. I love spicy food and not a wimp, but I don't like it when food is ridiculously spicy.  Each time I have gotten medium spicy and it hasn't been all that hot-will prob upgrade to spicy next time!
author: Alison H.

description: I've tried this restaurant twice now, once pick-up and once eat-in. Both times we ordered the pumpkin curry with chicken (sub brown rice) and pad see ew beef. The dishes were so delicious the first time that we had to get them again! When we dined in last night we were also treated to a live music performance (by adorable kids!) and a free beverage in celebration of the restaurant's one year anniversary. We also ordered the green papaya salad last night. This dish is usually one of my favorites but their rendition was just OK and scorchingly spicy (we ordered medium but it was well beyond that). Great service!
author: Nina C.

description:
Delicious Thai food, great value for money (portions are huge), and they deliver.  No, literally.  Also, be warned that I'm not an expert on authentic Thai food but I did at least grow up in Southeast Asia so I have some basis for comparison.

Pro tip:  In general if you have a choice of meat with a stir-fried dish, know that the chicken will be dry and the pork is usually miles better.  I don't eat much red meat so can't speak for the beef.


---- DRY NOODLES ----

Pad See Ew:  5 stars
Yummy, they have the sweet sticky soy sauce down! Reminiscent of the best fried carrot cake dishes in Singapore.

Pad Thai:  4.5 stars

Kao Soy:  2.5 stars
I just really didn't like the texture of these steamed egg noodles, perhaps it's just personal preference.  The curry sauce was okay but chicken strips were dry.  The best part of this was the crispy noodle bits they served on the side.

Rad-Na:  3 stars
Wide flat rice noodles in lots of gravy, but the gravy is so salty!  I would've loved to drink all the sauce otherwise.  And the chicken (cut in thin strips) was pretty dry.


---- NOODLE SOUPS ----

Beef Noodle Soup:  3.5 stars
Delicious beef balls, lots of other fatty beef and organs.  Good for when I'm ill and need a hearty soup.  Asked for reduced salt.

Duck Noodle Soup:  4 stars
I asked for reduced salt / MSG and it still turned out super flavourful.  Duck meat was delicious and juicy, we couldn't stop though we were stuffed.  They give so much duck meat, this lasts me two meals when I order it delivery.

Pork Leg Stew Noodle Soup:  4 stars
Delicious soup and fatty pork leg!  Again, reduce the salt.

Chicken Noodle Soup:  5 stars
Okay, HOLD UP.  How have I been ordering food from here for over 2 years and this is my first time getting this?  If you have eaten in the hawker centres / food courts of Singapore growing up, you will recognise this familiar, pure chicken broth taste it is amazing and reminds me of home.  Many Thai / Vietnamese / Americanised Chinese soups I've tried skew too sweet or too salty, but this has the perfect balance and the chicken flavour shines through.  The chicken is just boiled chicken but still better than the chicken that comes with rice and noodle dishes.  Gosh I would eat this every week--when I'm craving a legitimate Asian flavour, when I want something light, when I'm feeling under the weather.  It's more "bland" than the other noodle soups so if you want something really salty, get the Duck Noodle soup and if you want a punch of flavour get the Tom Yum soup.  But if you know what's up -- get this chicken noodle soup.


---- OTHER SAVOURY DISHES ----

Chicken Satay:  3.5 stars
Surprisingly good and tender, but not as flavourful or chewy as Singaporean marinated satay of course.

Ped Yang: 3.5 stars
Their duck is fantastic, but why get this when you can get the duck noodle soup?

Kao Pad Gang Khew: 4 stars
Green curry paste fried rice. Yummy and flavourful rice, but the chicken strips were a bit dry.  Their pork in general is better than .

Yellow Curry Chicken:  3.5 stars
Standard.  Satisfying.

Pineapple Fried Rice:  4 stars
Pineapple chunks, cashews, egg, onions, even raisins and carrots up in your rice.  Sometimes you're just craving it.  And House of Thai has your back.


---- DESSERT ----

Roti:  4 stars
How can something so simple taste so good?  Crispy dessert roti oozing with sweet condensed milk.  Goes great with yellow curry.
author: Letitia L.

description: Delicious pumpkin curry, generous sized chicken satay with yummy peanut sauce. Delivery was fast and free.
author: Amy R.

description:
I have been going to the first "house of Thai " at tenderloin area  for years. Now that they open at a closer location so I have to tried it and I love it!

They manage to keep all their great quality ( delicious and authentic Thai food  with the great value ) together. 

However I have to say this location is much more beautiful than their first location. So I will definitely come back and dine here more.

 And that's how " H O T 2 " become one of my favorite Thai restaurant in town!!!!!!
author: Dom G.

description:
Finally!  Real Thai food in the Lower Haight!  

We used to trek out to the OG House of Thai, but now we can get our spicy green curry fix within a 5 minute walk, hurray!

Real Thai spiciness, not sugary or watered down.  House of Thai 2, pls never change.  We love you in all your authenticity.  Leave the Americanized Thai food to Phuket Thai or whatever.
author: Lorin Y.

description:
DELIVERY REVIEW:

This is my number one Thai delivery spot. Portions are incredibly generous, and the food is delicious. 

We had the food delivered through Postmates, don't think they offer delivery otherwise.  

Got the Thai staples: green curry and a Pad Thai. More then enough leftovers for later, but I had to force myself to stop eating so I could save some.
author: Patrick T.

description:
To demonstrate how good this place is... My husband and I have gotten takeout from here three times in the span of the past 6 days. And not only that, we order take out probably only once every 2 weeks. 
The food is incredibly flavorful and fresh tasting. The people there when we went to pick up (they do deliver, we just live nearby so we walk) were very smiley and friendly. The interior looks really nice as well. 

The Ka Moo was delicious. The pumpkin curry, addicting. I have no doubt that everything is very good. Looking forward to trying out many more of their dishes.
author: Masami L.

description:
Stumbled across the restaurant coming back from an apartment search.

Fantastic, authentic tasting pad thai. The lychee iced tea goes down smooth and easy and was a sweet, delicious treat. Attentive service.

All this at a bargain price point. Definitely a candidate for multiple repeat visits.
author: Daniel L.

description:
This is a great first-date place. The ambiance with pillows and booths is both hip/modern and very Southeast Asian-inspired. I ordered the beef pad-se-ew for a cheap $9. Everything on the menu was cheap, which is why this is a great place to impress that first date without breaking the bank. 

The Thai iced tea came in a tall glass, in a way I've never seen it served before: it was delicious! One star off because the cocktail menu wasn't ready yet, but they explained that it's only because they just opened and are working the kinks out. I will definitely be back soon, and me and my friend personally thanked the servers and cooks on our way out the door. Well-done!
author: Maurice R.

description:
Came here on Thursday night with friends from out of town. We got the Pad Moo Grob (Crispy pork belly with chinese broccoli), Crab Fried Rice and Beef Pumpkin Curry medium spicy. They were all amazing. Just watch out for the spice levels - medium was just right for me. 

Service was attentive and the prices were very reasonable.
author: Anthony C.

description: Boyfriend and I love swinging by HoT2 when we want a quick bite to eat. Typically no wait. Great value. Clean and classy interior for its price range. To top it off, their dishes are better portioned and far more delicious than the two Thai eateries on Divisadero. Free thai iced tea with Yelp check-in always has us coming back for more!
author: Christina J.

description: So far I've been here twice and the food is good.  The only thing is that they put a bit too much garlic and that's coming from someone who loves garlic.  I guess you can ask them to put a little amount in there.
author: Ted Y.

description:
Yay! We have a good Thai restaurant in the hood!

*Great service
*Tasty food
*Nice and cozy decor
*Good portions
*Affordable

Everything our party of four had was good:
-pumpkin curry with prawns
-green duck curry
-catfish
-padthai noodles with chicken

Goodness
author: Monkey B.

description:
Good food if you're feeling Thai in the area, but not particularly worth seeking out for a top-level experience.

Pad Thai and Pulled Pork soup were both flavorful but not outstanding. The Pad Thai noodles were hot and plentiful, but somewhat clumpy and lacking structure. It was not overly sweet, but sweetness covered any complexity from the fish sauce or other herbs/spices. It had a solid home-cooked feel to it but without the little refinements and details that make it unique.

The Pad Thai was superior at Lers Ros, but this was definitely not bad if you're in the area and hungry for Thai.

Service was excellent. Water was refilled promptly and it was clear the servers were scanning our tabletop for apparent needs nearly every time they walked by. Plus, they changed the channel to football per request (which seems like normal customer service, but Tacolicious in North Beach berated me once for asking). 

Good for groups and grubbing quickly with friends. There were several gnats/flies that seemed very familiar and comfortable with the place; impress a date somewhere else.
author: Eddie L.

description: Ordered from here to get delivered late one Monday night. Super easy ordering, there are SO many things to choose from but menu items are numbered so it makes it easy to relay what you want. Delivery was running late, they called me to tell me, how thoughtful! Everything was delivered hot, exactly how we wanted, on time, and for a good price! Will definitely consider going back when we travel to San Francisco again.
author: Markie W.

description: I got the spicy Pad Thai and it was SPICY! I love spicy food and can handle a lot of heat but this had my mouth on fire. I had a hard time finishing all of it but it was so good I couldn't stop even when my lips were starting to tingle! Would most definitely get this again but maybe medium next time.
author: Meagan S.

description:
Oh boy, oh boy. My boyfriend and I were stoked to hear that House of Thai 2 was going to be the replacement restaurant for the revolving-door-of-Thai-restaurants on Haight Street. Before co-habitating, we both could order from H.O.T. in the Tenderloin, but our new digs were too far away for delivery. (Serves us right for moving to the "Quad" which is hopefully a name that will never stick for the Castro/Mission).

Before H.O.T. 2 opened, we branched out to a few other neighborhood Thai spots, but we always found ourselves comparing it to our favorite. And while we patronized the actual restaurant itself when possible, sometimes, you just want Thai delivered to you without getting out of your pajamas, although we would fit in perfectly with the TL crowd if we did venture out in our PJs.. but I digress.

Simply everything we have had is delicious. A bit greasy, but full of flavor. Our favorites include Pad Kee Mao and Pad Se Ew, complete with a start of Por-Pier Pak (Veggie Egg Rolls), and it has yet to disappoint. The Pad Kee Mao is great spicy, although we douse everything in Sriracha anyway for more of a kick.

We have yet to eat-in at this location, so we can only judge on delivery, and delivery time is either ridiculously fast, or GrubHub is estimating too long of a wait. (For example, we were quoted an hour, received it within 30 minutes). Delivery guy is extra nice, so we can't complain either! 

Clearly, we love this space and we are glad that "our Thai spot" is accessible for delivery yet again. I am hoping that everyone else loves it too, so that the next generically-named Thai spot doesn't have to take its place!
author: Bryan B.

description: Have ordered take out from them multiple times, always fast and always delicious at reasonable prices. Their Tom Kah soup and red curries are tasty!
author: Tristan E.

description: Great food, I LOVE all the noodle dishes but everything is good. Food comes out quickly, and prices are reasonable. This is my go-to Thai spot and one of the best Thai places is the city. Tip: check-in on yelp when you're dining in to get a free Thai iced tea!
author: Carrie R.

description:
I let the food be delivered.
My order was: Pad thai with added chicken and vegetables, vegetarian egg rolls and a thai iced tea.

the portion was decent and the food was not bad. I did have better thai food in my life but I would definitely order from there again since the price-service level is right and the choices on the menu are good.
author: Vera H.

description: Very poor service ! Our family dined here first time we had the worst experience.never come again !!!!!!Servers don't communicate with the costumers . When we ask something from the servers they don't even say yes or no word ....after we asked the bill they added gratuity on 5 people including 2 kids ...18 % tip .??? They deserve nothing !!!
author: Erdenebileg T.

description: I usually love this place. I've eaten there and had it delivered many times. This is the first bad experience I've had (delivery), but It was really bad! I ordered the catfish larb and it was quite literally too salty to eat. I love my salt, and I couldn't get more than 1/2 way through. My pad thai was watery. Not saucy - watery. There were no crushed peanuts (kind of important in pad thai) and it was generally very bland. There was so little sauce/seasoning, the noodles were still clear :(  Added extra vegetables ($1) - there were 2 pieces of broccoli and a lot of carrot. Hoping this was just an off night.
author: Britt J.

description:
This place replaced the previous "Sweet Basil" Thai place, and by all accounts and experiences, it is a big upgrade. 

I like to stick to the basic thai dishes - curries, pad thais, soups, and thai fried rice. 

i can honestly say that the thai fried rice, while simple, is quite delicious. In general, this place is dependable and consistent, which is all you can really ask for when ordering Thai from the same place multiple times.

Highly recommend it, great place to place 'pick-up' orders. 

my Go-to: Red Curry, a tom-yum soup, and a side order of thai fried rice.
author: Aunik B.

description: Went here in the middle of summer and it was quite warm inside to the point of being uncomfortable. The food was not bad, but nothing out of the ordinary. The staff were friendly, but seemed a little over worked. Can't say there was anything particularly good or bad about this place.
author: Sandy S.

description:
PLEASE BE WARNED: BUG INFESTED SPOT 

I would like to preface this review with the fact that I love thai food.  I've been to at least twenty thai food spots in San Francisco, (probably 75+ in my life) and this one is hands down the worst.  I came here with my partner tonight and we were both disgusted by the entire experience.  

Firstly, the service was poor.  Even though we were one of only three groups in the restaurant, we were rushed to order, and our servers openly chided us for not purchasing an alcoholic beverage.  Neither my partner nor I are 21.  Our waitress made a scene, and it was very embarassing (for her), as it came off as incredibly immature.

Secondly, when I went to move one of the pillows, I was so grossed out to find BUGS all over the benches.  This would not have been so bad if those were the only bugs, but they WERE NOT.  I glanced first at the walls, and then at the ceiling and under the table, and I  found that there were bugs plastered on every surface in the entire seating area.  My partner and I made to leave immediately, but the server forced us to wait and purchase their food, which was honestly very annoying.  We took the food home with us, and decided that we ought to at least try it after having been forced to waste our hard earned money.  

And guess what?  THERE WERE BUGS IN THE FOOD. Crawling, wriggling, and moving in and out of our rice noodles.  

Honestly, I have never been so disgusted; I felt like I was going to throw up.  I have no idea how any restaurant can survive with such blatant violations of basic cleanliness.

We reported the restaurant and hope that it will either be shut down or cleaned up.  We will not be returning, and will warn our friends and family to do likewise.
author: Imelda M.

description: This place is the worst. They say they serve far and wide yet placed and order on seamless and they waited 30 min to call and tell me it was outside of their delivery area (nob hill).
author: Amanda K.

description: Love the Thai food. Very flavorful. Delivery is mostly quick, but have had to wait more than an hour a couple of times. The food is spicy, so I would recommend ordering the food mild/medium.
author: Raktim M.

description: This place is like a "hidden gem" in the lower haight. The staff is friendly and the food comes out quick to order.  I ordered the pad kee maw mild spicy and it was very sweet and savory. The rice was fresh and the Thai ice tea was authentic. The place is rather small but it's a sacrifice for the food
author: Mel L.

description:
