Super tasty! I ordered the tom yum noodle soup and it was exactly what I needed. If you have a cold and crave something slightly spicy, fresh, and can clear out your sinuses. 

I also ordered the sweet sticky rice with mango. A perfect ending to a lovely, quickly delivered meal.
author: Lexi M.

description:
Good, neighborhood Thai food. 
Great Tom Yum soup for when you're sick with a cold. 
Not the most flavorful, but definitely not the least.
author: Chloe R.

description: Truly delicious Thai food! My dish, the steak salad, was tasty and well textured. Even despite the rather plain salad accompanying it, the steak more than made up for the lack of flourish. The old reliables (pad thai, etc.) are also quite solid here. The atmosphere is "meh" which isn't a big deal for me but it was quite hot and stuffy inside on a hot day. Probably fine temperature-wise on a normal SF day.
author: Alex C.

description: They cancelled our delivery for no reason. Won't order agin from them. ChowNow notified us via email, so we didn't notice for an hour that they'd cancelled.
author: Kathryn H.

description:
I have never been too picky when it comes to Thai food, but OMG this place is amazing. Now I see just how good it can be. Every dish I have tried is SO flavorful and delicious. 

I have tried and recommend the green curry, pad prik king, and pad ka na. 

So glad you have come to my neighborhood!
author: Sarah G.

description: very nice food. great peanut sauce. can get pretty spicy. Everything is hot and fresh. Have 1 -2 innovative items on the menu.
author: Raj R.

description:
This is the best Thai food place in the hood, but definitely not the city. 

We've ordered the curries, the pad thai, and the pad se ew (pretty good!). I don't think the pumpkin curry merits all those rave reviews... you can barely taste the pumpkin itself because the curry sauce overwhelms it. 

But! It's more than adequate, and a welcome addition to the neighborhood. Service is slow; they seem to be understaffed. When I phone in an order, they always say it will take 15-20 minutes and it always takes about 30-40 min, so plan accordingly!
author: Angela K.

description: House of Thai 2 is a solid Thai neighborhood joint. I can always count on decent curry and soup for a reasonable price
author: Makela C.

description: Me and my girlfriend came in and got seated instantly, I ordered #75 which is pretty much just Chicken fried rice, It was really good. Nothing bad to say about this place! Highly recommend.
author: Paul S.

description:
Compared to other Thai restaurants in the city, House of Thai is okay. Decent neighborhood spot if you live in the. Haight. You can get better Pad See Ew at Thai Thai Noodle on California & Hyde. Pumpkin curry was delish - would definitely get it medium spicy as dishes here aren't too over the top. 

In general, all of the dishes ordered here have too much salt - papaya salad comes with dried shrimp on top that adds to the saltiness (a dish which already has plenty of sodium from the fish sauce dressing) and pad see ew (the noodles are a dark brown color rather than the golden color that's typical). I'd definitely come back for the curry - flavors of the pumpkin curry are very comparable to Modern Thai on Polk St. 

If you go when it's busy, the restaurant gets a quite warm inside because there's nowhere for the hot air from the kitchen to go - makes it a bit uncomfortable depending where you sit.

Overall, good food, but not my favorite Thai restaurant in the city. Worth checking out.
author: Tim S.

description:
I walked in and they sat me right away. However it took a whole for them to take my drink/food order. In fact I ordered them together because I was ready by the time they came by. I'm not even sure they realized they didn't take my drink order yet. The waiter was hard to communicate with. I wanted a cup of Tom Yum, not a full order since I was dining alone. But the server could not understand what I meant by cup of soup or single serving or small. He responded by saying "chicken?"  I gave up. I also had to point to the numbers on the menu because he didn't know the numbers when I said them allowed. 

It was very busy. Lots of people in and out picking up and ordering to go. So it's very popular in the neighborhood. It was very clean the atmosphere was great but no AC. Back of the restaurant gets very warm!  

I did check in on YELP so I got my free Thai Iced Tea and it was delicious. I also ordered a Thai dish I've never had. House of Thai noodle and that was excellent as well. I ordered medium spice and it was not spicey at all. I'm guessing he didn't understand me or forgot.  My Tom Yum soup with medium spice on the other hand was VERY spicy.  Both were good. No complaints about the taste of the food. 

Everything was very fresh. In fact I watched the waiter step outside to help another young gentlemen carry in the groceries right through the restaurant.  I give the food a 4 and service a 2. So that's why I gave them a 3 for overall. I'm still waiting on my check as we speak.
author: Juli P.

description: The spicy is SPICY! Amazing Pad Thai and hella spicy.. I'm a spice lover and next time I'll order it medium spice level.
author: Stacey R.

description: Excellent barbecue chicken, better than the Tenderloin location.
author: Inigo M.

description: I love this place! The food is on point! Not only do I eat in the restaurant but I also order delivery from here. The service is always great. Delivery is also great because they deliver right to the front door!
author: Kim D.

description:
Very mediocre, (almost BAD), and very expensive. Ordered pumpkin curry and all I could taste was salt and pepper. No real flavor or curry taste.
Definitley would NOT recommend
author: Julie V.

description:
My favorite Thai restaurant!!! Best food. Excellent customer service! ;-) They are consistently good and we are so happy to have house of Thai in the lower haight! 

Get the duck noodle soup, pad see ew, or fried chicken fried rice. Add an egg on top. Good grief! So good!
author: Melorra G.

description:
Arrogant delivery guy. Food arrived after an hour and he demanded tip for delivery even though it said free delivery. Food was tasteless and dessert was missing. When enquired they sent a text saying it will be left at Lobby and I should pick it up. 

Absolutely reckless service.
author: Priyanka A.

description:
Nice little place, Pad Thai with tofu! and chicken with pumpkin curry! 
Very good!
author: Joe H.

description: Only 1 word needed to describe HOT2: SOLID. Great food, good price, always on point.
author: Julian M.

description: The service is not always the best, especially when you're ordering for pickup, but I always enjoy their spicy jerky appetizer, pad kee mao, and khao soi and the fact that they actually honor my request to make things extra spicy. We recently tried the fried chive pancake/dumpling thing and thought it would be like the fried corn fritters we had at other places, but they came out to be a lot bigger and juicier (filled with more chives) than expected (pleasant surprise), and came with a delicious dipping sauce (dark vinegar and soy sauce with green onions or something).
author: Jenn C.

description: This place is ridiculously slow. Everyone in the kitchen was looking at their phones constantly and made food for friends while I just sat and waited. Sat and waited. Ridiculous. Hope the food is decent because the service sucks.
author: k g.

description: Yummy! I've tried lots of Pad Thai and this is definitely at the top of my list. Only bad thing was that the server was not nice or engaging at all.
author: sarah c.

description: ordered several dishes to be delivered.  Total scam, the bill came up with additional charges that had nothing to do with the order.  The person who answered the phone and the deliver person both had different stories of what the bogus charges were.  Oh, did I mention the food was bland?  Lesson learned!
author: Mark W.

description: Decided to stop in here for lunch one day and it was wonderful. So good that we came back for dinner, and I ordered the exact same thing. Vegan pad Thai - and the waitress confirmed egg, no meat. About halfway through the dish there was a piece something chewy, sort of like overlooked shrimp, or gristle. Not only did they still charge me for it, they argued with me about whether or not it was meat. It was so disgusting I nearly lost my dinner anyway, if you know what I mean. And they were completely defensive and shitty about it. I didn't even complain, but my brother mentioned it when the waitress asked how everything was, and then she turned it into this huge deal trying to convince me it wasn't a piece of meat. Gross gross gross.
author: Erica M.

description: Great Thai iced tea! My favorite dish is the pineapple fried rice with sausage. Very flavorful. I also enjoy their pad Thai with extra peanut sauce.
author: Summer M.

description: The pad Thai here was definitely on point. Me and my man split it and were really satisfied. We also split an order of fish cakes as an app. The fish cakes were okay, I probably wouldn't order them again although the sauce served with them was dope. Regardless, the pad Thai was excellent and I've had that dish all over the world and only one other compares to this one (Siam garden in red bank, NJ). Go for it! Small place but quick service!
author: Casey S.

description: Excellent, out of the way hole in the wall.  Try it please.  We ere just looking for a quick place to eat in the Haight and came across this wonderful place.
author: Wayne S.

description:
Decent neighborhood spot but probably better for delivery than actually dining in.  Service was pretty poor - ordered two entrees and an appetizer and they brought one entree out and didn't bring the second entree for another five minutes, and then brought the appetizers out after the main meal started.

Got the Beef Noodle Soup and the Red Curry w/ Tofu, both were fairly bland and flavoreless.
author: Svengal M.

description: I have lived in San Francisco for five years and haven't found a good Pad Thai until we had it delivered last night from House of Thai 2.  I don't like it sweet or too saucy.  Finally this was perfect. The rest of the food delivered was just fine, but I am just so thrilled with the Pad Thai I can't stop thinking about it.
author: Carolyne C.

description: You'll feel like you walked into a Bangkok hot spot coming to House of Thai 2. From the spicy authentic food to its exposed kitchen, heat is a recurring theme here. Medium spicy means 3 alarm (to me any ways) but I don't mind sweating it out over a bowl of Tom Young Goon. This is a healthier escape from my normal boring routine of burritos and various fried meat. Glad there is a Thai place worth bragging about in my neighborhood. Now just a long trip to Phuket Island and the whole experience would be complete!
author: Rodney D.

description: This place is great. They never let me down...especially with their curry selection
author: Travis F.

description: Decided to grab something to eat after checking into our hotel, and this was one of the only places open at 10:15. The employees were very friendly, the food was pretty good, and the walk from our hotel was only half a mile away. We ordered the Pad See Ew with chicken and the vegetables with tofu covered in peanut sauce. Compared to some of my favorite Thai joints in LA, the Pad See Ew was okay however their fried rice and veggies with peanut sauce were good. For the price (about $9 a plate - good portion) I'd recommend the House of Thai 2!
author: Brian A.

description: Yummy tho still looking for the Thai delivery place in SF to blow my mind.
author: Byrne B.

description: Always the worst customer service, whether you dine in or take out. The last time, we had placed an Eat24 order 20 minutes before arriving and upon arrival, they hadn't even started cooking! Every time they act confused even though six people are bustling around. The food may be good but never again.
author: Chad S.

description: So much love for House of Thai. I'm Malaysian/have been to Thailand many times and the food they serve here is pretty legit and as spicy as it should be. Have gotten both take out and dined in over the past few weeks and every experience has been great. Also the staff are really nice. Definitely my go to Thai spot in the Lower Haight.
author: Anastasia V.

description:
This place is f#$%ing awesome. Best Thai food in the hood. Twice as good as the restaurants that came before it at this location. Best dishes:

Pad Thai
Kao Pad Goon-Chiang - Fried rice with Chinese sausage, egg, carrot, dice green bean, and onions. Amazing.
Larb
Tom Yum

Just shut up and go there already.
author: WeAreAllLamp L.

description: Hard to find good gai koor noodau anywhere, this place has some of the best I've ever tried, I eat here all the time now
author: Trevor M.

description: my life just got a little better, love house of thai (fka thai house express) and it just opened store #2 on Haight (x Fillmore) and took over the space filled by many who came and went.  house of thai is here to stay! I love the crab fried rice, wonton soup, pad see ew, kao soy, duck noodle soup, garlic ginger rice, and many more!
author: Wakako U.

description: Not bad, not great. Ordered delivery from here a couple nights ago and it was nothing special. Tom Yum soup was ok, nothing to call home about. The Pad Thai lacked flavor and the papaya salad was extremely spicy...so spicy I could barely taste any of the food afterwards. One advice if you're ordering for take out, cook rice at home and order the main entree without the rice. The portion difference is insane.
author: Cody M.

description: The flavors fell short, service was impersonal and inattentive, restaurant needs cleaning and mending. We were the only customers (aside from a couple to-go orders) at 6:30 on a Thursday -- now I know why. Tried it once, won't be back.
author: Jessica L.

description: Waited an hour for a delivery order that was cancelled 8 minutes before they closed.. Kinda shitty.
author: Savanna B.

description:
solid Thai in a renovated (yet again!) space that has seen 3 previous Thai places come and go in the span of 2 years. hopefully the renovations corrected any previous bad feng shui, and these folks will stick around. if tonight's takeout was any indication, they are moving in the right direction.

hungry, lacking ingredients to cook, and not wanting to brave the rain (having drenched my Toms on the way back from work (note to self, do not wear sock shoes when the streets are wet!)), we decided to eat in and have a Thai delivery (+ true detective!) party. noting that the new place to take over the previous sweet basil nee terrific thai nee chili cha cha nee ?? (in that order)) was ---now open!---, a google search revealed a menu and phone number. success!

hits were chan pad poo (crab cellophane noodles (as seen at marnee thai!)), pumpkin curry with beef (spicy!, even as mild), rad na with chicken, and garlic and ginger rice (2 side orders is enough for 4). the chicken satay app was pretty decent too, though the steamed assorted vegetables more resembled a salad that was cooked (wah wah - but, all things considered, must get those 5-a-day in somehow, and for $4, decent flavor, & variety, no complaints).

delivery was friendly and prompt (they said 40 minutes, and it took ~45-50 from call to delivery), and the woman who took our order was polite and careful (if a bit slow - though, more time = no mistakes = good tradeoff). will visit again - esp as the menu has some pretty interesting things to try (think best hits of lers ros + marnee on top of usual neighborhood thai fare).
author: D C.

description: I got the pad se-ew and it was AMAZING!! I used a yelp deal and got a free thai iced tea which was one of the top thai iced teas I've ever had. Only reason for four stars instead of five was that it was incredibly stuffy inside. Very little ventilation.
author: Robin N.

description: Great place! The food is extremely flavorful and if needed they can make the food quite spicy, which is always awesome. The Tom Kha soup is incredibly tangy and tasty - a must try.
author: Akshata R.

description:
So I usually order take out from this place and when it's good its GOOD but when it's bad, it's just a gut bomb that takes three days to recover from. 

NONETHELESS, a friend was in town and craving Thai. This place usually has great pad kee mao and pad see ew so we decided to go in (despite my mixed reviews). I ordered the pad kee mao (the dish I ALWAYS get) - ordered medium. Upon taking one bite my mouth started burning uncontrollably. I tried to suck it up and enjoy the rest of my noodles but it was just way, way, way too hot. Remember - I always order this MEDIUM and have never experienced this level of spice. I kindly ask our server if I can have some white vinegar to tone down the spice. She takes my plate instead and insists on replacing it. Ok. Then I hear banging around in the kitchen, grunting and yelling from the lady cook in the back. She was not happy about this. 5 minutes later my noodles come back out and I start eating... much better. Then, the cook decides to come out to the table and explain to me that THAI spice is not like AMERICAN spice and I should really understanding that THAI CHILI is not like AMERICAN Food (she kept reiterating how I was American, and obviously this means I do not understand ethnic spices). In fact, I spent two months in Thailand backpacking around and trying various local dishes.

"Yes yes I know, actually I dine here quite frequently and I always get this dish. Today it was overwhelmingly spicy. I like spicy. Spicy is great. This was overwhelming and i simply asked for white vinegar; no one had to replace it." 

She huffs and puffs and makes my friend and I feel incredibly uncomfortable for being there. I sat there in shock. Who comes out and scolds THE ONLY TABLE IN THE RESTAURANT?? Totally unacceptable and RUDE!! I will never be back. I hope the chef learns some manners and realizes that insulting Americans in an AMERICAN PLACE OF BUSINESS is no way to gain repeat customers.
author: Jane B.

description: Randomly choose to eat here without doing any research.  To our surprise we really enjoyed all their items we ordered.  The crispy pork and green beans fried with peppers and basil was absolutely awesome!  The ingredients were very fresh and ordered it spicy.  Had a bite of the pad se euu also and that tasted great too.  This is the second restaurant which had to have meant the first one did well, and it sure is!!
author: James F.

description: I order delivery and they were VERY late. The food arrive almost cold, the portions were very small, including the soup container in just 3/4 full. The guy wanted me to come downstairs to pick it up after been so late. And after that, the quality of the food was just plain average. BIG DISAPPOINTMENT!!!!
author: Jesus S.

description: Best Thai delivery in the city. Food is the same quality you would get in the restaurant (delicious!) and delivery is always quick. I won't order Thai from anywhere else now
author: Kelly G.

description: Absolutely delicious and authentic!  Tried the pumpkin curry which surpassed expectations. Second dish was also amazing, forgot the name cut had glass noodles, pork & shrimp - medium spice was perfect, hot but not lingering.
author: Hannah W.

description: I've only gotten to-go food here, but the interior is nice too. Food is great, there are a LOT of options!
author: Nancy B.

description: This may just be an unlucky experience, but I was really craving shrimp fried rice. When I finally got it here, I didn't like the fishy taste to it. It made me sad that my craving wasn't satisfied, but my friend ordered some noodles which ended up being a lot better. If I ever come back, I guess I'll just try something else.
author: Emily N.

description: I had a good experience here one afternoon.. t was quiet and the food was delicious. Will definitely return.
author: Dominique P.

description: First time ordering from this place. My Pad Thai came with a clothing tag mixed in (like the kind from the inside of a t-shirt).  I called the restaurant to let them know, sent them a picture and asked that they send a new one and refund me for the dish.  They said they would do one but not both, which in my opinion was pretty poor customer service, especially since it's unacceptable to have clothing tags mixed into the food.  It seems others have had good experiences here but can't say I'll be ordering from them again.
author: Emmy M.

description: Nothing mind blowing but menu had a lot of options!
author: PJ L.

description: Excellent Thai food!!! Super fresh, great quality.  Dine in and take out are both done nicely.  Well priced and consistent.
author: Julia S.

description: I enjoyed my experience here. Service was super nice and helpful and food was good. (Tom kha soup) I'm interested in coming back to try the fried rice. Free thai iced tea with purchase deal was a nice add on.
author: Beck P.

description: I would give this place 0 stars if possible. Don't waste your time trying to order delivery through the ChowNow app. They don't check for orders. I placed an order and called the restaurant 34 minutes later to check how much longer it would be, and the woman on the phone first claimed there was no order, and then claimed that they just received the order and that it would be another 90 minutes. It's obvious they don't pay attention to online orders. Won't eat here again, especially since there are at least 4 other Thai restaurants within walking distance of our apartment.
author: Isha D.

description: Very traditional and food was delicious. I bought the beef salad and wasn't disappointed. Look forward to coming back.
author: Powell K.

description:
Thai is my favorite cuisine and there just haven't been any decent spots in my neighborhood, so I was very excited to give this new place a shot. I ordered the Pad Thai as any Thai place can be typically judged based on how it prepares it's staple dish. 

It was excellent. Exactly what I've been looking for in my neighborhood. The only downside was that the place was running extremely hot for some reason, but they relocated me to a spot by the window to their credit. Hopefully this is just a temporary issue. Very happy to give this a 5 story rating!

EDIT: Went back twice more! Got the pumpkin curry and then the pad see ew. All incredible! Make sure to ask for the spice tray for the pad see ew though :)
author: Michael B.

description: Delicious food and fast service!  The curries are flavorful and have great veggies in them!
author: Emily P.

description: Best crab fried rice I've had in a long time.  They were very good at accommodating out special food restrictions and needs :)
author: Anddy A.

description: Pretty tasty food - a little bit on the sweet side but otherwise very good.  Went for lunch but will come back for dinner next time.   My only wish is that they would have some kind of lunch special - may not be but feels odd to order an entree at lunch.
author: Eric H.

description: I had takeout and was shocked by the lack of portions size.  The cashew chicken was the size of a Lean Cuisine.  Tasty, but it left me hungry hours later.  The brown rice came on one side of the black plastic dish and was more plentiful than the entree.
author: Chad P.

description: Ordered at 5:30 pm, the  food was not delivered till 7:10 pm, so it was not very hot, and we were super hungry by that time.  They also put shrimp into my pad thai, when I had only ordered tofu.
author: Marissa H.

description: Great Thai place! Went here for dinner the first night of our stay in San Fransisco, and it was delicious. Two of us had pad-see-ew with chicken that was delicious. The flavor was great, but wished there was more broccoli in it.
author: Meghan P.

description: They're food is pretty damn good. Service is ok nothing special but their food! Their pad Thai and chicken larb salad are amazeballs. They're not stringy with the meat and tofu like most places. Good portions and decent pricing. Parking can be really hard though and sometimes it's really busy. Awesome food and clean place
author: Jewlz L.

description: I'd be remiss if I didn't write this post. I live across the street and I've been through the countless iterations of Thai restaurants in this spot, patronizing them all. While the food at Thai House 2 TASTES better than the previous iteration, it has given my husband and myself food poisoning three times. THREE TIMES. I feel like a fool for giving them more chances but after last night, no longer. We both always order the same dish and after the first two times we swore off the restaurant for months. I don't know why but I was really craving Thai last night and we decided to give it another go. We didn't have anything too fancy, just a curry, some pad thai and satay. HOLY FOOD POISONING. I almost had to call an ambulance for my husband to get him to the hospital because he was in such a bad state. Normally I'd write off a single incidence of food poisoning but after three times I STRONGLY recommend avoiding this restaurant. It tastes good but I'm no longer willing to gamble with my health.
author: Patrice S.

description: Ordered delivery on a Sunday night & it took 90 minutes to arrive (estimated time was 45-60). Main entree was supposed to be pumpkin curry with tofu, but it came with chicken, so couldn't eat it. The other 2 dishes (egg rolls & pad kee mao) tasted okay but were barely warm. Entirely disappointed.
author: L F.

description: Pretty solid food that doesn't cost an arm and a leg like other Thai places in the city. Friendly service a plus too.
author: Inago R.

description: Delivery took 90 mins on a Tuesday night, food was greasy and the coke can came at room temperature. I wouldn't order from here again.
author: Andy S.

description: I'm excited to have this place in Lower Haight, just adding to the great restaurants in this neighborhood. I went last night and had the Pumpkin Curry with brown rice which was a large portion and excellent. My roommate got the Pad Thai, which was a smaller portion but he said tasted excellent. I'm excited to eat here a lot more and will update this review as I try more items on the menu.
author: Jake L.

description: Not worth the wait! I ordered from GrubHub, the food was delivered 2 hours later and it was cold!
author: Carol C.

description: This place deserves a review for providing delicious fresh Thai comfort food. Out of all the Thai places on haight street this ranks among my top two favorites. I haven't been able to bring myself to order anything but the crab noodles or crab fried rice. Huge portions for a meal less than 10-15 bucks. Just a warning that their spicy is SPICY!
author: Christina C.

description: DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY FROM HOUSE OF THAI 2. This is not a review of the food - it might be quite good, but I did not get to find out.  I ordered delivery on a Sunday at 7:30 and given the delivery window of 60-90 minutes - at 100 minutes the food had not been delivered so I called. The receptionist told me that my food was still in the restaurant because they were busy - there was no apology. Starving, I cancelled my order and will not ever order delivery from this restaurant.
author: Tighe B.

description: I ordered a delivery for a rice dish via Yelp. According to Yelp menu the item was supposed to come with rice. There was an option to make it ala carte by paying an extra $2. I assumed ala carte would mean that the dish was bigger. Well, apparently the ala carte option meant that they left the rice out. I received a tiny portion without rice. I called the restaurant and asked for the rice. They told me that the ala carte option doesn't come with rice. I told them that in the menu on Yelp it was indicated that the dish always comes with rice. The restaurant repeated me three times that what I ordered doesn't come with rice, no matter how I tried to tell them that their menu stated otherwise. I cooked my own rice. I asked Eat24 to change the menu and they told me that they called the restaurant to bring me rice. When I already had the rice in a boiling water the restaurant called me and told me that they could bring rice in 15 minutes. I told them not to bother, as the rice I was cooking would be ready by then. The second star is for them calling me back afterwards.
author: Tomi M.

description: Delivery in less than 15 minutes, crazy fast. Pumpkin curry (beef) and drunken noodles (chicken), crazy good.
author: Tae L.

description: Two or three other Thai restaurants have tried to make a go at this location but I think this will be the last one.  At least I hope so as I want them to be around for a long time!  The food is awesome whether you get it delivered or dine in and the staff are really nice.
author: Joseph S.

description: My go-to neighborhood Thai place. Fast and friendly service, tasty food, and affordable prices. What more could you ask for?
author: Jena W.

description: Thank you House of Thai 2, I came in with my Boyfriend for dinner on Monday night. we were in a bit of a hurry due to his work scheduled. The service was very attentive and food came out pretty fast good price. Usually I'm not a fan of Thai but Ive totally been converted. will definitely recommend this place.
author: Tom R.

description: We ordered delivery from House of Thai 2 via the eat24hours app. While the food was of good quality they completely ignored our request to make one of the dishes not spicy and the other one mild, both dishes were pretty hot which was ok for me but inedible for my wife, its too bad as the food was otherwise pretty good
author: Jon R.
